15.text:
JASON SILVA: I think a lot
about the psychology of spaces,

19.text:
the intention of
architecture, the capacity

22.text:
to design dwellings that
inform our inner world.

26.text:
You walk into a room, and
you start feeling better,

29.text: and you don't quite know why.

30.text:
Then you realize the
lighting, the shapes,

33.text:
the lines, the shadows,
everything about how we've

36.text:
installed, impregnated, mind
and intention and agency

40.text:
into the physical form, shows us
the ways in which architecture,

43.text:
in which design, is really about
the design of the inner spaces.

47.text:
When you design the "without,"
you design the "within."

51.text: And this is a wonderful idea.

52.text:
I think architects
don't get celebrated

54.text:
enough in our society, because
these are the people that

56.text:
allow us to design cities,
spaces, and dwellings

61.text:
And if anything, architects
should work together

65.text:
who understand the impact of
shapes, shadows, and forms
